departmentDescription: The Department of Art and Art History offers to the student, regardless of experience or major, the opportunity to develop a sensitivity to visual language through studio work and the study of the history of art.

courses: Two of the following 100-level courses: 101: Drawing, 102: Digital, 105: Painting, 107: Sculpture, 116: Animation (not to be paired with 102)
Art History 152: Survey of Contemporary Art
Four additional courses in the Department of Art and Art History including at least two 200 level and above studio classes and at least one 300 level studio course.
For a BA in Art History:
Three additional courses in art history at the 200 level or above
Art 485: Senior Seminar in Art History
Two of the following: 101: Drawing, 102: Digital, 105: Painting, 107: Sculpture, 116: Animation (may not be paired with 102)
Art History 152: Survey of Contemporary Art
Two studio art courses at 200-level or above
Three courses in art history at the 200 or 300 level, with one from each of the three areas of concentration (Ancient, Medieval through Baroque, Modern)
Art 485: Senior Seminar in Art History

requirements: In the spring of the junior year, an art major, in consultation with an appropriate member of the art faculty, may write a proposal for honors work to be carried out in the senior year. The department must approve the proposal.
An overall grade of A- on the thesis or project itself is required for honors credit.
